docs.snippet: An early advance in United States Government bonds yesterday on the Stock Exchange caused a general rush to buy bonds of all descriptions and the turnover for the day rose to $17,751,000, the largest amount since Dec. 30, when tax selling was an...
docs.lead_paragraph: An early advance in United States Government bonds yesterday on the Stock Exchange caused a general rush to buy bonds of all descriptions and the turnover for the day rose to $17,751,000, the largest amount since Dec. 30, when tax selling was an important factor.

headline.main: GOVERNMENT LOANS LEAD BONDS IN RISE; Turnover Is Largest Since the Heavy Volume That Marked Year-End Tax Selling. MANY ADVANCES OF A POINT Rails, in Active Demand, Gain 1 to 10 Points -- Lower-Rated Liens in Van in Foreign List.

docs.snippet: Buying enthusiasm in the bond market on the Stock Exchange yesterday ran the gamut from United States Government bonds to defaulted foreign, loans, but it was difficult to decide whether the government's obligations for domestic railroad bonds made...
docs.lead_paragraph: Buying enthusiasm in the bond market on the Stock Exchange yesterday ran the gamut from United States Government bonds to defaulted foreign, loans, but it was difficult to decide whether the government's obligations for domestic railroad bonds made the best showing.

headline.main: BONDS MOVE HIGHER IN WAVE OF BUYING; Federal Securities and Home Rail List Lead Advance on Stock Exchange. FOREIGN LOANS ALSO GAIN Latin-American Issues Rally and Australian Group Displays Unusual Strength.
URUGUAY VOTES DEBT DELAY; Sinking Fund Suspension Is Now Authorized by Congress.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Comparative steadiness of foreign loans in the face of irregularly lower prices of bonds of domestic corporations and the United States Government featured dealings on the Stock Exchange yesterday. The losses in the two last named groups did not...
docs.lead_paragraph: Comparative steadiness of foreign loans in the face of irregularly lower prices of bonds of domestic corporations and the United States Government featured dealings on the Stock Exchange yesterday. The losses in the two last named groups did not amount to much and trading slowed down considerably on the decline.
docs.abstract: T F Lee says many reptd Latin-Amer defaults are only technical

headline.main: FOREIGN LIST HOLDS AS HOME BONDS DIP; Trading in Domestic Issues Slackens Considerably as Prices Recede. JUMP IN JAPANESE LOANS Fair Strength in South American Group -- German Section Is Steady to Firm.

docs.snippet: The bond market on the Stock Exchange continued irregularly lower yesterday on a turnover of only $10,571,500, which was the smallest full day's business for the year to date. The bonds of no single group moved in unison. Only one of the isssues of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The bond market on the Stock Exchange continued irregularly lower yesterday on a turnover of only $10,571,500, which was the smallest full day's business for the year to date. The bonds of no single group moved in unison. Only one of the isssues of the United States Government list showed a gain for the day, this amounting to 4-32 point.

headline.main: BONDS MOVE DOWN ON STOCK EXCHANGE; Turnover $10,571,500, the Smallest Total for a Full Day This Year. FOREIGN LOANS DECLINE One Federal Issue Gains, Two Are Unchanged, While the Others Lose Ground.

docs.snippet: One hour after the case had had been placed in its hands by Judge Nott yesterday, a jury in General Sessions returned a verdict of acquittal in the misdemeanor trial of Henry R. Swanson, John S. Wallis and John Erter, engineers, on an indictment...
docs.lead_paragraph: One hour after the case had had been placed in its hands by Judge Nott yesterday, a jury in General Sessions returned a verdict of acquittal in the misdemeanor trial of Henry R. Swanson, John S. Wallis and John Erter, engineers, on an indictment charging they disclosed confidential information obtained a few years ago in the course of their employment by the Foster Wheeler Corporation at 165 Broadway.

headline.main: JURY FREES ENGINEERS OF DISCLOSING SECRET; Three, Now With Alco Products, Consider Suit Against Foster Wheeler on False Arrest.

headline.main: Uruguay Gets Bid to Chicago Fair.

docs.snippet: Bond prices moved downward in comparatively quiet trading on the Stock Exchange yesterday. Pressure against railroad issues, although not particularly insistent, resulted in lower quotations, as a whole. Foreign loans showed considerable irregularity...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bond prices moved downward in comparatively quiet trading on the Stock Exchange yesterday. Pressure against railroad issues, although not particularly insistent, resulted in lower quotations, as a whole. Foreign loans showed considerable irregularity and United States Government bonds were off slightly for the day.

headline.main: BONDS MOVE DOWN ON STOCK EXCHANGE; Rail Issues Under Moderate Pressure -- Federal List Off Slightly. TRANSIT UPSWING HALTS Foreign Loans Irregular, With South Americans Making the Best Showing.
